page.title: 18THE STATION AREA
page.content: Newton Abbot grew rapidly in the nineteenth century as a Victorian { {railway}town.Today the railway station is still important and many streets of small terraced housing show how and where the town developed. Beside the railway a modern{industrial estate}has been established that is occupied by mainly light manufacturing businesses. This part of the town is not without its open spaces,and an attractive park called{Courtenay Park}spreads out in front of the imposing station facade. Towards the the centre of the town along{Queens Street}the takeaways and restaurants give way to clothes shops and and large stores. Offices of all types occupy sites in the centre itself. The{bus station}still flourishes providing a service to neighbouring towns and villages as well as coach tours for the summer.
